nodes.text: The Naboo Spacelines StarSpeeder 1000 was a modified StarSpeeder 1000 spacecraft used by interstellar travel agency Star Tours to operate flights bound for the Mid Rim planet Naboo prior to 0 BBY. This starship was painted yellow and light grey with a red circle containing a white Aurebesh letter Nern. It was named after both the planet as well as Naboo Spacelines, a separate spaceliner company from Star Tours, which was a fellow member with Star Tours in the Galactic Tourist Bureau.

It was equipped with hyperdrive and shielding systems, two flash cannons and two laser cannons; it was crewed by a pilot, an astromech droid and a systems analyst. It could support up to 40 passengers.

The Naboo Spacelines StarSpeeder 1000 was first introduced on The Walt Disney Company website in 2011 as a papercraft model. The speeder was also released in the same year in a set of diecast toys, the StarSpeeder 1000 Spaceliner Collection.

According to a Star Tours: The Adventures Continue poster sign, only Star Tours flew StarSpeeder 1000s, which confirms Star Tours ownership of this vessel. The Japanese version, however, indicated that it was part of a separate company which was affiliated with Star Tours via the Galactic Tourist Bureau.
